definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
machine/engine/opportunity/intention/aircraft/pivot/crucial point/flexible (quick-witted)/organic/CL:臺|台[tai2]
surname Ji

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

sentences.english: I have no idea what they are going to say, so I'll have to play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我一点不知道他们将会说什么，所以我只好见机行事。

sentences.english: Opportunity must be seized and acted upon in order to have value.
sentences.chinese: 必须抓住机会，见机行事才能创造佳绩。

sentences.english: I’ve had no time to prepare for this meeting,so I’ll have to play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我没有时间来准备这次会议，所以我只好见机行事。

sentences.english: He is a man who knows the time of day.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个能见机行事的人。

sentences.english: Since you don't know the language, I can only suggest that you follow your nose.
sentences.chinese: 你既然不会这门语言，我只能建议你见机行事。

sentences.english: I am not prepared the speech, so I have to play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我没准备演讲稿，到时只好见机行事。

sentences.english: We have no set plans, We're just going to do AS we see fit.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有即定的计划，我们将见机行事。

sentences.english: I don't know what they'll want when they arrive─we'll have to play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他们到达时需要什么我们只有见机行事了。

sentences.english: He learned to pick up on his superior's moods and act accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 他学会了注意上级的情绪并见机行事。

sentences.english: John decided to play it by ear when he went for his interview.
sentences.chinese: 约翰决定面试的时候见机行事。

sentences.english: When using loudspeakers , be sure to use your discretion. You can't teach others with a cudgel.
sentences.chinese: 使用高音喇叭，千万要见机行事，不能授人以柄。

sentences.english: We don't know what to do now, so we must play by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我们不知怎么做，所以必须见机行事。

definition: to act as circumstances dictate (idiom)
to change according to the situation (idiom); pragmatic
to wait for the opportune moment before taking action (idiom)
to take one's time making a decision (idiom)/to consider at length
to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to keep cool/to stay calm
to take by ruse/to outwit/to outsmart
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to look for an opportunity
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
counter soldiers with arms, water with an earth weir (idiom); different situations call for different action/to adopt measures appropriate to the actual situation
pinyin: bing1 lai2 jiang4 dang3 , shui3 lai2 tu3 yan3

definition: Only an outstanding talent can recognize current trends (idiom). A wise man submits to circumstances.
pinyin: shi2 shi2 wu4 zhe3 wei4 jun4 jie2

definition: a wise man knows better than to fight when the odds are against him (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 han4 bu4 chi1 yan3 qian2 kui1

definition: a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
